evidence: discrete Fourier transform, or DFT, and its inverse, the IDFT
Fourier analysis is central to all of these areas
analyze and process signals in both continuous and discrete forms
move back and forth between the time or spatial domain and the frequency domain
perform operations such as convolution, Fourier transforms, and inverse Fourier transforms in one dimension, two dimensions, and beyond

Fourier analysis is central to all of these areas. We’ll use it to analyze and process signals in both continuous and discrete forms, and to move back and forth between the time or spatial domain and the frequency domain, in either a continuous or discrete form.
